item.title: JoBeth Hamon jumps into Ward 6 Oklahoma City Council race
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
JoBeth Hamon, 28, announced Tuesday that she is running for the center-city Ward 6 Oklahoma City Council seat open in 2019. Meg Salyer has held the seat for a decade, first taking office in 2008 after substantial involvement for years in city committees before that. She will retire at the end of this term. Hamon […]

The post JoBeth Hamon jumps into Ward 6 Oklahoma City Council race appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: East side pastor chosen to fill interim Ward 7 OKC Council seat
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Council chose Pastor Lee E. Cooper, Jr. for interim Ward 7 Council member Tuesday after considering 18 applications for the post. He will be sworn in at the beginning of the next Council meeting June 19 and take his seat immediately. Cooper has already been involved in city government serving as the […]

The post East side pastor chosen to fill interim Ward 7 OKC Council seat appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Gary Goldman stepped onto the patio of his Cultivar Mexican Kitchen restaurant, pulled out his cell phone and started frantically texting. Streetcar line construction vehicles had collected in front of the building on N. Broadway Ave blocking parking and the view of his restaurant at the beginning of lunchtime Thursday. His lunch customers are what’s […]

The post Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: April 19 — bombing victims, lessons learned remembered with purpose
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Thursday marked the 23rd memorial service for the 168 killed in the 1995 Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building bombing in Oklahoma City. Of those, 19 were small children. There are certain rituals of the service that people in attendance have grown to expect: bagpipes are played, remembrance speeches given and the names of all 168 […]

The post April 19 — bombing victims, lessons learned remembered with purpose appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Streetcar open house draws crowd on nice day – Gallery
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The only thing that went wrong for EMBARK staff at the streetcar open house Friday downtown was that they brought only 300 t-shirts when well over 500 came by. It was a beautiful day and a line had already formed down the street by 11 a.m. when they opened. Here is our gallery of sights […]

The post Streetcar open house draws crowd on nice day – Gallery appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Innovation District gets green light for further dev
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Over the next 21 days planners will be submitting big ideas about what to do next in the Innovation District east of downtown. The district includes the State Capitol grounds and OU Medical Center on NE 13th St. (See map below) The Innovation District was created earlier this year after extensive research by the Brookings […]

The post Innovation District gets green light for further dev appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: What has changed since OKC Black Lives Matter rally 2016?
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Rev. T. Sheri Dickerson is happy when she thinks about the Black Lives Matter rally in Oklahoma City one year ago. She describes it as the day when activists in Oklahoma “got it so very right.” But she, Rev. Jesse Jackson and Tamya Cox talked with Free Press this week about their continuing concerns for […]

The post What has changed since OKC Black Lives Matter rally 2016? appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Big yellow bus in Pride Parade marks shift for OKCPS
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
It almost looked like some confused school bus driver had lost his way and ended up in the OKC Pride Parade. But the appearance of the big yellow school bus Sunday was no error. Oklahoma City Public Schools has made a major shift from silence to active involvement in affirming LGBTQ students with a recent […]

The post Big yellow bus in Pride Parade marks shift for OKCPS appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: 30th OKC Pride Parade draws big, diverse crowd
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
In its 30th year, the OKC Pride Parade provided another big, colorful, loud celebration of happy differences. OKC Pride Parade organizers reported 110 different groups who applied for a spot in the 2017 event. It’s no longer called the “Gay Pride Parade” as it was in its earliest years. The name evolution reflects a move […]

The post 30th OKC Pride Parade draws big, diverse crowd appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Junk causing tensions in NW OKC neighborhood
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Persistent junk accumulations at two adjacent northwest Oklahoma City homes are causing increasing tensions between the owner and his neighbors. Public records show that neighbors have been calling the City of Oklahoma City Action Center about 2436 NW 42nd St. since 2011 and 2440 NW 42nd St. next door since 2012. There have been 204 […]

The post Junk causing tensions in NW OKC neighborhood appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
